intro: Univiscidiatus halleanus, commonly known as the spiral-shaped sea anemone, is a unique marine invertebrate found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the order Hexactinellida, characterized by its glass-like skeleton formed from silica. The organism exhibits a distinctive spiral arrangement of its tentacles, which are used for capturing prey. Its body is typically translucent, allowing for the observation of its internal structures. This species plays an important role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the biodiversity of coral reef environments.
